name: Ancient Egyptian
description: Architecture of ancient Egypt characterized by monumental structures, pyramids, temples, and elaborate tombs.
characteristics: Massive stone structures, hieroglyphic carvings, axial symmetry.
examples: Great Pyramid of Giza, Temple of Karnak.

name: Ancient Greek
description: Architecture of ancient Greece known for its harmony, balance, and use of columns.
characteristics: Symmetry, columnar facades, pediments, friezes.

name: Ancient Roman
description: Architecture of ancient Rome characterized by grandeur, arches, and vaults.
characteristics: Architectural arches, vaults, domes, concrete.

name: Byzantine
description: Architecture of the Byzantine Empire with a blend of Roman, Greek, and Eastern influences.
characteristics: Domes, rounded arches, mosaics, rich ornamentation.
examples: Hagia Sophia, Basilica of San Vitale.

name: Romanesque
description: Romanesque architecture characterized by thick walls, round arches, and barrel vaults.
characteristics: Round arches, thick walls, small windows, decorative arcading.

name: Gothic
description: Gothic architecture known for its pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and flying buttresses.
characteristics: Pointed arches, ribbed vaults, stained glass windows, flying buttresses.

name: Renaissance
description: Architecture of the Renaissance characterized by a revival of classical elements.
characteristics: Symmetry, classical orders, domes, mathematical proportions.

name: Baroque
description: Baroque architecture known for its drama, grandeur, and intricate detailing.
characteristics: Curves, elaborate ornamentation, dramatic use of light and shadow.
examples: Palace of Versailles, St. Peter's Square.

name: Rococo
description: Rococo architecture characterized by elegance, decorative motifs, and asymmetry.
characteristics: Ornate decoration, pastel colors, asymmetry, light-heartedness.

name: Neoclassical
description: Revival of classical architecture characterized by simplicity and order.
characteristics: Symmetry, classical orders, clean lines, restrained ornamentation.

name: Georgian
description: Architecture of the Georgian era known for its proportion, balance, and elegance.
characteristics: Symmetry, classical proportions, sash windows, ornate doorways.

name: Victorian
description: Architecture of the Victorian era characterized by eclecticism and ornate detailing.
characteristics: Ornamentation, eclectic styles, decorative elements, textured facades.

name: Gothic Revival
description: Revival of Gothic architecture popularized in the 19th century.
characteristics: Pointed arches, ribbed vaults, decorative tracery, tall spires.

name: Art Nouveau
description: Artistic style characterized by organic forms and ornate decorative motifs.
characteristics: Curvilinear forms, flowing lines, floral motifs, stained glass.

name: Beaux-Arts
description: Academic architectural style characterized by grandeur and classical elements.
characteristics: Symmetry, monumental scale, classical ornamentation.

name: Arts and Crafts
description: Reaction against industrialization with an emphasis on craftsmanship and simplicity.
characteristics: Natural materials, handcrafted details, simplicity, functionalism.

name: Art Deco
description: Style characterized by geometric forms, sleek lines, and decorative elements.
characteristics: Geometric patterns, streamlined forms, decorative motifs.

name: International Style (Modernism)
description: Modernist architectural style emphasizing functionality and simplicity.
characteristics: Simplicity, clean lines, open spaces, lack of ornamentation.

name: Brutalism
description: Style characterized by raw concrete, bold forms, and expressing function.
characteristics: Exposed concrete, geometric shapes, functional expression.

name: Postmodernism
description: Rejection of modernist principles, combining historical references and playful design.
characteristics: Historical references, irony, eclectic forms, ornamentation.

name: Deconstructivism
description: Style characterized by fragmentation, distorted forms, and unconventional geometry.
characteristics: Fragmentation, non-linear forms, complex geometry.
examples: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, Walt Disney Concert Hall.

name: Neo-Futurism
description: Futuristic architectural style emphasizing technology, sustainability, and organic forms.
characteristics: Sustainable design, biomorphic shapes, high-tech materials.

name: Neo-Expressionism
description: Style characterized by expressive forms, bold colors, and sculptural elements.
characteristics: Expressive forms, bold colors, sculptural elements.
examples: Casa da Música, Walt Disney Concert Hall.

name: High-Tech Architecture
description: Style emphasizing the use of industrial and technological elements.
characteristics: Exposed steel structures, use of steel and glass, technological aesthetics.

name: Sustainable (Green) Architecture
description: Design approach focused on environmental and social sustainability.
characteristics: Energy efficiency, use of renewable materials, ecological design.
examples: The Edge, Masdar City, One Angel Square.

name: Parametricism
description: Style characterized by complex, algorithmically generated forms and patterns.
characteristics: Curvilinear forms, intricate patterns, computational design.
examples: Heydar Aliyev Center, Guangzhou Opera House.

name: New Classical
description: Revival of classical architectural principles combined with modern techniques.
characteristics: Classical proportions, traditional detailing, modern construction methods.
examples: Quadracci Pavilion, Public Library of New South Wales.
